Package GameParts

Class Metadata

java.lang.Object
GameParts.Metadata
All Implemented Interfaces:
FolderOutputterMetadataInterface
public class Metadata
extends java.lang.Object
implements FolderOutputterMetadataInterface
This object basically represents the metadata for the HECCIN' Game

    A method that wraps the start passage finding stuff
    private void findTitle()
    A method which finds the title metadata
    private void findVariables()
    Attempts to find the variable declarations within the metadata stuff, adding each of them to the variables arrayList Variables must be in the form !Var: variableName 1 or more word characters (alphanumeric+underscore) = defaultValue defaultValue must be 1 or more non-whitespace characters optional // comment comment is anything between the // and the end of line optional
    java.lang.String getAuthor()  
    java.lang.String getIFictionMetadata()
    Returns the info from this metadata object, but in the form you'd expect to see in an iFiction file

    Returns the IFID string, but formatted such that it's usable in the HTML page

    java.lang.String getTitle()  
    boolean isAllOptionalMetadataDeclared()
    Returns true if all the optional metadata was declared, false otherwise

    A method which does the metadata regex matching things
    java.lang.String outputMetadataDefinitionInstructions()
    Outputs a string containing instructions for how to output all currently-undeclared optional metadata
    void parseMetadata()
    Wrapper data for the metadata parsing stuff Does nothing if there's no metadata to parse

  • Field Details

    • rawMetadata

      private java.lang.String rawMetadata
      string with the raw metadata

    • hasMetadata

      private boolean hasMetadata
      boolean value to keep track of whether or not this actually has metadata

    • title

      private java.lang.String title
      what the game title is. defaults to "An Interactive Fiction"

    • isTitleDeclared

      private boolean isTitleDeclared
      whether or not the game title was declared. false by default

    • author

      private java.lang.String author
      author name. "Anonymous" by default

    • isAuthorDeclared

      private boolean isAuthorDeclared
      whether or not the author was declared. false by default

    • startPassage

      private java.lang.String startPassage
      The starting passage. defaults to "Start" if undefined

    • isIfidDeclared

      private boolean isIfidDeclared
      Whether or not the IFID was declared. False by default

    • ifid

      private java.lang.String ifid
      The IFID. empty by default

    • variables

      private java.util.ArrayList<Variable> variables
      All the variable definitions

    • multilineComment

      private java.lang.String multilineComment
      The multline comment held within the metadata

  • Constructor Details

    • Metadata

      public Metadata​(java.lang.String givenMetadata, boolean isThereActuallyMetadata)
      This is a constructor for the metadata object
      Parameters:
      givenMetadata - the raw, unparsed, metadata as a string
      isThereActuallyMetadata - true if there actually is any metadata, false otherwise

  • Method Details

    • parseMetadata

      public void parseMetadata()
      Wrapper data for the metadata parsing stuff Does nothing if there's no metadata to parse

    • metadataRegexHandler

      private java.lang.String metadataRegexHandler​(java.lang.String regex, java.lang.String input) throws NoMatchException
      A method which does the metadata regex matching things
      Parameters:
      regex - the regular expression being looked for in the input
      input - the string that the regex is being applied to
      Returns:
      the string that was found by the regex from the input
      Throws:
      NoMatchException - if no match was found

    • findStartPassage

      private java.lang.String findStartPassage​(java.lang.String rawData)
      A method that wraps the start passage finding stuff
      Parameters:
      rawData - the raw metadata
      Returns:
      the name of the defined starting passage ("Start" if it wasn't defined)

    • findIFID

      private void findIFID()
      Finds IFID declaration

    • findTitle

      private void findTitle()
      A method which finds the title metadata

    • findAuthor

      private void findAuthor()
      Method to find the author metadata

    • findVariables

      private void findVariables()
      Attempts to find the variable declarations within the metadata stuff, adding each of them to the variables arrayList Variables must be in the form !Var: variableName 1 or more word characters (alphanumeric+underscore) = defaultValue defaultValue must be 1 or more non-whitespace characters optional // comment comment is anything between the // and the end of line optional

    • findComment

      private java.lang.String findComment​(java.lang.String rawData)
      This reads the multiline comment within the metadata (all lines starting with //)
      Parameters:
      rawData - the full metadata being read
      Returns:
      the multiline comment held within the metadata (as a string)

    • doesStartPassageExist

      public boolean doesStartPassageExist​(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> passageNames)
      Used to check whether or not the start passage exists
      Parameters:
      passageNames - set of all defined passage names
      Returns:
      true if that set contains startPassage, false otherwise

    • isAllOptionalMetadataDeclared

      public boolean isAllOptionalMetadataDeclared()
      Returns true if all the optional metadata was declared, false otherwise
      Returns:
      AND product of all the optional declarable metadata

      public java.lang.String outputMetadataDefinitionInstructions()
      Outputs a string containing instructions for how to output all currently-undeclared optional metadata
      Returns:
      String with the instructions

      public java.lang.String getIfidButHtmlFormatted()
      Returns the IFID string, but formatted such that it's usable in the HTML page
      Specified by:
      getIfidButHtmlFormatted in interface FolderOutputterMetadataInterface
      Returns:
      the appropriate string for declaring the IFID in the HTML page

    • getIFictionMetadata

      public java.lang.String getIFictionMetadata()

      Returns:
